title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut pancetta into small pieces and cook in a pan over medium heat until crispy. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, Pecorino, Parmesan, and plenty of black pepper.
Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain pasta.
Immediately add hot pasta to the egg mixture, stirring quickly to avoid scrambling. Add pancetta and a splash of pasta water to loosen.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth, buttery, creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, turmeric, and half the garam masala for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-sear chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a large pan, sauté onion until soft. Add garlic and ginger; cook 1 minute.
Add canned tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes. Blend until smooth (optional).
Return sauce to pan, stir in cream and remaining garam masala.
Add chicken pieces, simmer 5–10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy mix of colorful vegetables sautéed in soy-ginger sauce.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add harder vegetables (carrots, broccoli) first; stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables; cook 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Push vegetables to side, add ginger and garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss everything together.
Serve hot over rice, garnished with sesame seeds.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Soft, chewy cookies loaded with melty chocolate chips — a timeless favorite.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment.
In a bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat butter and sugars until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla; mix well.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet, mixing until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop tablespoon-sized dough balls onto sheets. Bake 9–11 minutes until golden.
Cool on sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to rack.
